The Leonardo DRS Airborne and Intelligence Systems business is a global leader and strategic partner committed to delivering world-class, full life-cycle defense and intelligence products that protect the security of our nation and our allies. From air combat training to state-of-the-art electronic warfare systems, our technology is deployed by virtually all U.S. military and government agencies around the world.

Job Summary

DRS Signal Solutions is looking for Co-op students for a position that provides current students the opportunity to contribute to technical projects and tasks in their area of interest/study. This particular opening is for a Software Engineering co-op that’s expected to contribute in embedded software development, integration and test.

Job Responsibilities
  • Apply computer science, engineering, and mathematical analysis concepts and principles in the development of software for the target application
  • Under the direction of engineers, work closely with cross functional members of the engineering organization to develop and evaluate interfaces between hardware and software, and operational performance requirements and design of the overall system
  • Support and participate in all phases of the software development life cycle, including requirements analysis, design, implementation, integration, and test of embedded software for real-time control of advanced radio systems
  • Participate in peer reviews, identify, track and repair defects
  • Utilize a variety of software languages (C, C++, Java, Python, Bash) on embedded Linux platforms.
  • Carry out basic work instructions that will help in understanding the fundamentals of the Company’s Product Lines
  • Assist in creation and maintenance of various build environments and software tools
  • May be required to help in research in a particular field
  • Perform a wide variety of tasks to gain familiarity with the engineering staff, methods, programs and practices
  • Perform other duties as assigned
Qualifications
High school diploma or GED
  • Must be enrolled in an accredited Software/Computer Engineering or Computer Science degree program (or related scientific/technical discipline) at a sophomore level or higher
  • Must have a GPA of 3.0 GPA or higher, especially in-major GPA
  • Relevant course studies may include: Operating Systems. Object-Oriented Programming. Database Management Systems. Computer Architecture. Data Structures. Algorithms & Complexity
  • Programming languages such as C/C++, Java. Scripting with Python and Bash
  • Previous internship/co-op experience preferred
Leonardo DRS, Inc. and its subsidiaries and affiliates are equal opportunity employers and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Full Job Description
Facebook, we have many opportunities to work with data each and every day. In this role as a Business Intelligence Engineer Intern on the Supply Chain Analytics team, your primary responsibility will be to partner with key stakeholders, data engineers, data scientists and analysts to support and enable scaling Facebook’s Infrastructure Data Center Supply Chain. You will be responsible for creating the technology that moves and translates data used to inform our most critical strategic and operational decisions. You will also help translate business needs into requirements and identify efficiency opportunities. In addition to querying and visualizing data, you will be expected to use your expertise and provide meaningful recommendations and actionable strategies to partnering data engineers for performance enhancements and development of best BI practices, including streamlining of data sources and defining metrics. The ideal candidate will have a passion for working in white space and creating impact from the ground up in a fast-paced environment. This position is part of the Infrastructure Supply Chain team.
Lead development of multiple BI projects with business stakeholders
Manage task assignments for team of supporting contractors to ensure project success
Work with Data Science, Data Engineers to define BI strategy and engagement models
Build business intelligence solutions that balance high-performance and usability
Design, build and launch reliable dashboards that provide insights across cross-functional global teams
Manage security and privacy standards for the BI solutions through administrative responsibilities
Intelligently design visualizations that focus on usability and ease of interpretation
Deploy inclusive data quality checks to ensure high quality of dashboards
Enhance existing dashboards and maintain all domain-related dashboards
Collaboration with the Supply Chain SMEs, Data Scientists, Data Engineers and Program Managers to define metrics
Communicate progress, risks, and completion of projects to stakeholders
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or Interdisciplinary programs including the above disciplines
Experience with SQL (Oracle, MySQL)
Experience with Python
Knowledge of data modeling concepts and experience accessing data from data warehouses
Hands-on experience working with medium to large datasets (i.e. data extraction, cleaning, analysis, and automating/scheduling data pipelines)
Experience with data visualization software (e.g. Tableau)
Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
Curious, self-driven, analytical and excited to play with data
Ability to thrive in a fast paced work environment
Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Full Job Description
No Relocation Assistance Offered
# 113543 - Piscataway, New Jersey, United States

Colgate-Palmolive is a leading global consumer products company, tightly focused on Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care and Pet Nutrition. Colgate sells its products in over 200 countries and territories around the world under such internationally recognized brand names as Colgate, Palmolive, Speed Stick, Lady Speed Stick, Softsoap, Irish Spring, Protex, Sorriso, Kolynos, elmex, Tom’s of Maine, Sanex, Ajax, Axion, Fabuloso, Soupline and Suavitel, as well as Hill’s Science Diet, Hill’s Prescription Diet and Hill’s Ideal Balance. Do you want to come to work with a smile and leave with one as well? In between those smiles, your day is comprised of connecting with others across the world, stimulating discussions, and making impactful contributions.

The Experience

At Colgate-Palmolive, we offer an exceptional Internship Program within the Global Information Technology Department. Our program provides Interns with the opportunity to work with a global and diverse workforce as well as apply their conceptual knowledge of business and technical skills within a global consumer products company. Throughout our program, Interns will gain exposure to the latest business practices and cutting edge technologies. Additionally, Interns will function as integral team members throughout the development life cycle by working with business and technical analysts to evaluate issues, develop solutions, implement processes, and support existing applications.

Each Intern is assigned to a unique team and project working in areas including Mobile Development, Full-stack development, Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence, and more. Essentially, the program is a structured education strategy integrating the students’ academic knowledge and career goals with learning through productive work experiences in a sphere related specifically to Global Information Technology. Our Internship program provides students with valuable work experience as well as providing Colgate-Palmolive with a source of highly talented candidates.

Who are you?

You are a collaborator- In this role, Interns get opportunities to network with multiple cross-functional teams. These relationships thrive on mutual trust and integrity to achieve deliverables and execute against the strategy and goals.

You are an innovator- You look for opportunities to improve and seek creative solutions and you’re able to adapt and adjust the strategy and direction of your work if necessary.

You are curious- You’re curious about what works and what does not and are willing to take the initiative to find out.

What you’ll need

Must currently be enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program at a college or university

Majoring in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Business/ IT Systems Management, or a related field

A minimum GPA of 2.8

Documentation of authorization to work in the United States, not requiring visa sponsorship now or in the future

Technical knowledge and skills, completed course work, projects, or relevant work related experience

Familiarity with programming languages and web-related technologies

Equal Opportunity Employer
Colgate is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, marital status, veteran status (United States positions), or any other characteristic protected by law.

Are you interested in working for Colgate-Palmolive? You can apply online and attach all relevant documents such as a cover letter and resume or CV. Applications received by e-mail are not considered in the selection process. Become part of our team. We look forward to your application.

Colgate-Palmolive is a leading global consumer products company, tightly focused on Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care and Pet Nutrition. Colgate sells its products in over 200 countries and territories around the world under such internationally recognised brand names as Colgate, Palmolive, elmex, Tom’s of Maine, Sorriso, Speed Stick, Lady Speed Stick, Softsoap, Irish Spring, Protex, Sanex, Elta MD, PCA Skin, Ajax, Axion, Fabuloso, Soupline and Suavitel, as well as Hill’s Science Diet and Hill’s Prescription Diet.

To learn more about Hill's and the Hill’s Food, Shelter & Love program please visit http://www.hillspet.com. To learn more about Tom’s of Maine please visit http://www.tomsofmaine.com.

description:
Full Job Description
ADP is hiring Application Development Interns. Are you looking for real corporate experience at a Fortune 250 company? Do you want to make a valuable contribution to a business' success?
Are you ready to join an energetic, collaborative team and experience an inclusive culture of belonging?

As an Intern at ADP, you will work alongside seasoned professionals who will guide and support you to enhance your professional skills while gaining relevant experience in a business environment. Even better : you will also participate in a variety of functional and leadership activities to enhance your personal and professional capabilities. Your objective: to learn as much as possible and gain relevant business experience during your time interning with us.

A little about ADP: We are a global leader in human resources technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, human resources, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition as a global Best Places to Work and a recipient of many prestigious awards for diversity, equity, and inclusion, including a DiversityInc® Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. Whether you want real-world experience with programming, scripting, coding, designing, mainframe, hardware or troubleshooting, we have opportunities to gain experience in the following areas: Work with our world-class computer scientists and engineers on project based assignments to build the next generation of ADP's innovative products Network with GPT leaders and associates who will guide and support you as you enhance your skills and gain experience and an overall understanding of the business Gain real-world experience with today's leading technologies in programming, scripting, designing, or web development

You're always learning, growing, questioning, and challenging "what's been done before." Agile Solution Seeker . You're a problem solver who always can find the right answer even in times of fast-paced change.

YOU'LL LOVE WORKING HERE BECAUSE YOU CAN:

Continuously learn. Ongoing training, development, and mentorship opportunities for even the most insatiable learner.
Balance work and life. Resources and flexibility to more easily integrate your work and your life.

position: Intern - Business Analyst - Summer 2022- CO or NATIONWIDE
description:
Full Job Description
About Lumen
Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.

The Role

Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology. During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time. Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace.
The Experience
  • Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems
  • Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects
  • Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization.
  • Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.
The Main Responsibilities

As a Project Management Intern in our North America Field Operations & Network Implementation organization, you will work collaboratively with our team to assist customers in activating and testing products and technologies. Tasks during the 10 weeks will have impact on the customers as well as the business. Project Manager interns will have the potential to learn about fiber products, project management, data research, and many other Lumen programs. This will give interns the opportunity to have a customer facing role while also improving the company through research, management, and technical training.

  • Onsite manager will be available for on the job training and coaching of the intern.
  • Assist with our Revenue Acceleration Program
  • This role will provide experience in project management, collaboration, and general business meeting practices.
  • Communicate and coordinate actions across the team based on the data identified.
  • Engage in the active Automation/Transformation projects and provide PM support
  • Provide PM support for select Top 10 projects underway within our organization
  • Engage in Employee Engagement activities
  • Participate in the DIB (Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging) program
  • Engage in the Training program. Complete entry level virtual lab modules and provide feedback
  • Provide Teams and Sharepoint support
  • Engage in Data Analytics
  • Ride along with the various teams to better understand the team structure and responsibilities
  • Complete a presentation at the end of the internship to summarize the experience and provide feedback
What We Look For in a Candidate

  • Pursuing a Bachelors degree in business or tech related field – Telecommunications, Business management, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or similar degree program.
  • Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university; Junior or Senior education status at the start of the internship (graduating August 2022 – May 2024).
  • GPA: 3.0 or higher preferred, not required
  • If position is in office, must have transportation to/from work daily
  • Must be available to work 30 – 40 hours, during the specified 10-week timeframe.
  • Experience with Microsoft suit is required
  • General techology knowledge is appreciated
  • Candidates are expected to exhibit critical thinking skills and time management/prioritization skills.
  • Work well in collaborative group settings.
  • Detail oriented.
  • Able to learn and adapt quickly.
  • Strong sense of urgency and ability to meet deadlines
  • Ability to demonstrate ownership and accountability
  • Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
What to Expect Next

After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position. A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application. For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application. Thank you!

position: Technology Leadership Development Program (TLDP) Co-Op Intern
description:
Full Job Description
Company Summary

Taking care of our customers, our communities and each other. That’s the Travelers Promise. By honoring this commitment, we have maintained our reputation as one of the best property casualty insurers in the industry for over 160 years. Join us to discover a culture that is rooted in innovation and thrives on collaboration. Imagine loving what you do and where you do it.

Target Openings

5

Job Description Summary

The goal of the Technology Leadership Development Program (TLDP) Co-Op is to attract and develop self-motivated individuals who are highly skilled and passionate about a career in technology while providing a foundation for future success within the organization.

As a TLDP Co-Op intern, you will be exposed to a challenging professional work experience in technology with planned activities giving you insight into business, technology, and the many career options at Travelers. You will not only be able to gain a deeper understanding of what you can do in technology but also who we are as a company and how you fit within our Technology community. You will receive a combination of hands on experience, access to a technology curriculum, as well as a mentoring program. You will have the opportunity to interact and network with many levels of leadership and management. You will interact with fellow co-op interns through networking and development opportunities.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities

The Co-Op internship offers hands on experience in areas of software engineering which is supported by a technology and business development curriculum, an assigned co-op manager, and technical mentors. The six-month experience will provide first-hand opportunities for interns to apply what they have conceptually learned in academia in a real-world setting.

Minimum Qualifications

Obtained or pursuing a technology or business-related undergraduate degree with technology minor; or a graduate degree with a technology minor; or the successful completion of a state-licensed accelerated technical learning program in technology (e.g. bootcamp) teaching foundational software development skills.
Legally authorized to work in the United States now and in the future.

Education, Work Experience, & Knowledge

Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or greater preferred; Suggested majors include (but not limited to): Software Engineering, Math, Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, and Cybersecurity.
Exposure to Object-oriented programming (OOP) in one major language.

Job Specific Technical Skills & Competencies

Accountability: Strong track record of taking ownership and responsibility for actions and outcomes, performance, and results.
Analytical and Critical Thinking: Demonstrated aptitude in identifying current or future problems or opportunities, analyzing data, synthesizing and comparing information to understand issues, identifying cause/effect relationships and exploring alternative solutions to support sound decision making.
Change Management/Resilience: Ability to remain energized and focused in the face of ambiguity, change or strenuous demands.
Customer Focus: Proven customer service skills with the ability to provide service excellence to internal or external clients.
Emotional Intelligence: Demonstrated track record of self and social awareness, empathy and balances confidence with humility.
Interpersonal: Excellent communication skills with the ability to actively engage with others while maintaining a positive attitude.
Judgment/Decision Making: Capability of exercising sound judgment, making decisions and committing to a position.
Learning agility: Demonstrated aptitude for learning and applying new capabilities in actuarial and analytics.
Leveraging Differences: Proven capacity to works with and include people from different backgrounds, experiences, cultures, races, etc. and view those differences as assets to be leveraged to accomplish business goals and objectives.
Relationship Management: Strong relationship management skills including the ability to seek out, build, foster and maintain productive relationships, networks or alliances to meet goals and achieve results.
Teamwork: Ability to work together in situations when actions are interdependent, and a team is mutually responsible to produce a result.
Technical curiosity: Self-starter with a strong track record of exploring new technologies, applications and environments beyond required job and/or educational commitments.
Work Ethic: Possession of a strong drive to do what it takes to get the job done; inquisitive and demonstrates a strong willingness to learn.

Employment Practices

Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We value the unique abilities and talents each individual brings to our organization and recognize that we benefit in numerous ways from our differences.

If you are a candidate and have specific questions regarding the physical requirements of this role, please send us an email so we may assist you.

Travelers reserves the right to fill this position at a level above or below the level included in this posting.

To learn more about our comprehensive benefit programs please visit http://careers.travelers.com/life-at-travelers/benefits/.

position: Intern Customer Experience – Strategy and Analytics / Planning and Program Management
description:
Full Job Description
Company: FedEx Services
Job Title: Intern Customer Experience – Strategy and Analytics / Planning and Program Management
Job Requisition Number: RC418574
Category: Intern
Pay Type: Non-exempt

Locations:
Memphis, Tennessee 38125
United States

Are ready for your career to take flight with FedEx? Join us for our 10-week internship program where you work on real-world projects, collaborate with team members, and have fun along the way. At FedEx, our internship program is for college students who are pursing either an undergraduate or graduate degree. As a FedEx intern, you will be working on projects directly related to your degree getting you valuable, real-world experience. Our culture at FedEx, is putting people first. We promote growth and opportunity for all of our employees. FedEx interns will also have the opportunity to participate in several organized events including community service, executive speaking engagements, and networking opportunities. Deliver what’s next in your career with FedEx by applying today!

Position Summary
This is a posting for several related assignments available within the FedEx Customer Experience organization. Customer Experience handles problem resolution for customers and designs solutions for shippers and recipients. This is a 10-week assignment for students pursuing a college degree. Assignments are directly related to an intern's academic degree. Interns will have direct supervision and perform duties as assigned. Interns will participates in a number of organized events providing visibility into the overall operations of FedEx.

Position Information
Full-time internship opportunity from June 2022 to August 2022. This position can be domiciled in the Memphis TN area.

Under close supervision, the successful candidate may assist with the following: project management, project planning, process mapping, data analysis, workflow documentation, learning design and development, packaging engineering support (testing and design), and report automation. The intern may assist with technology industry research, global business intelligence, and emerging trends analysis. The project may relate to a mobile app, geo-fencing, revenue systems and tools, or another initiative.

The intern may assist with:
Conducting data analytics, report development, and/or research.
Interacting with business partners and/or staff to gather, design, and document software requirements matched to business needs.
Documenting systems functions and business process flows.
Assisting in the design/development of program content, program flow, writes scripts, develops storyboards to produce educational learning media.
Provide engineering support in the functions of package material testing, package test procedure development, thermal testing, package design, and packaging consultation through direct customer contact.

What are we looking for in a summer intern?
Our ideal candidate will have the following skills and experience:

Strong analytical/quantitative, project/program management, organizational, leadership, presentation, and verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to manage multiple tasks, set priorities and monitor ongoing results.
Ability to synthesize big data (quantitative and qualitative); Report design/development.
Knowledge or experience with one or more of the following: data analytics, forecasting/modeling, strategy planning, engineering planning, operations, economics, process mapping, database query creation, web development, project management, instructional systems design and development models as applied to computer-based instruction.
Coursework or experience in global studies.
Basic knowledge of one or more of the following: the software development process, systems applications and architecture, Query Languages, “R,” MATLAB, Python, C++, objective-C, SQL, Adobe Captivate, Adobe InDesign.
Knowledge of PowerPoint, Keynote or Prezi and the Microsoft Office suite.

The following are considered a plus:
Enrollment as undergraduate at junior year or above or graduate student in Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Operations Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, Process Analysis, Systems Analysis and Design, Decision Science, Data Science, Statistics, Applied Statistics, Quality Improvement Analytics, Informatics, Mathematics, Business, Management, Finance, Accounting, Economics, Industrial Psychology, Communications, Education, Instructional Design, Behavioral Science, Graphic Arts, Packaging, or other related major.
Ideally, plans to graduate within 12 months of completing the internship and begin full-time employment.

Make sure your resume has the following information:
College address and permanent home address.
Email address.
Telephone number.
The following regarding the degree you are currently pursuing:
Name of college/university.
Degree (For example, bachelor’s degree, master’s degree, or doctorate).
Major and/or minor.
Overall GPA.
Major GPA.
Date of intended graduation (Month and year).

Domicile Location:
This position can be domiciled in the Memphis, TN area or the Memphis, TN area.
The ability to work remotely within the United States may be available based on business need.
Relocation assistance not available.

The company does not offer immigration sponsorship for the permanent position(s) that will be offered to successful interns who are hired into the Foundations Program or full-time entry level positions (below the SK salary band).

Qualifications
High School graduate or equivalent. Student has completed at least two years towards a college degree. Completion of an undergraduate degree or higher. OR Enrollment as undergraduate or graduate student in Engineering, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Math, Business Administration, Operations Research, Marketing Analysis, Computer Science, Computer Technology, Packaging Science, Information Systems, Education, Instructional Design, Behavioral Science, Psychology, Communications, Graphic Arts, or other related major.

FedEx Services is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetics disability, or protected Veteran status.

FedEx Services will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee, unless undue hardship or a direct threat would result from the accommodation. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact recruitmentsupport@fedex.com.

Full Job Description
Who We Are:
Bandwidth lives for innovation! Our technology powers brands like Google, Microsoft, GoDaddy, Arlo, Netgear, Zoom, Rover and more of the most exciting leaders in technology. Our intelligent voice, messaging, 9-1-1 access, and phone number services— all backed by Bandwidth's own nationwide, all-IP voice network—allow us to power the way people communicate, connect, and do business.

At Bandwidth, your music matters when you are part of the BAND. We celebrate differences and encourage BANDmates to be their authentic selves. #jointheband

What We Are Looking For:
Are you excited about the position and its responsibilities, but not sure if you're 100% qualified? Do you feel you can work to help us crush the mission? If you answered 'yes' to both of these questions, we encourage you to apply! You won't want to miss the opportunity to be a part of the BAND.

We're looking for a Software Development Intern (Keystone) who has an eye for great user experience and is experienced in building data-driven web applications. We're seeking somebody who loves building web applications and is passionate about web technologies. If your idea of fun is spinning up a Flask service or forking a codepen to add some javascript, we want to talk to you.

What You'll Do:
As a part of Bandwidth's Keystone (Authentication Services) team, you'll work alongside the team creating Bandwidth's next-generation authentication infrastructure. In doing so, you'll gain valuable experience with real-world, hands-on problems relating to Identity and Authorization. You'll have your pick of challenging and impactful problems to solve in cooperation with seasoned experts in auth, and the solutions to your problems will be part of the backbone of Bandwidth's identity backbone.

What You Need:
Working towards a Bachelors degree in Computer Science or an equivalent course of study
0-3 years of experience in Software Development
A passion for high quality user experience
Experience with Java, Go, Node or Python
Interest in understanding large-scale Identity and Auth

The Whole Person Promise:
We make a "Whole Person" promise to our team. You can have both meaningful work PLUS a full life at Bandwidth. We focus on accomplishing our mission as "whole people." That means we take care of our people—in body, mind, and spirit.

Fitness: 90-minute fitness lunch with a paid gym membership for workouts. On-site cardio gym, locker room/showers, classes, and sponsored sports and leagues. Nutritionist and personal trainer on-site.
Volunteer: We have a program dedicated to providing volunteer opportunities to employees, BandwidthCares.

Applicant Privacy Notice

We're looking for a Product Management Intern (R&D) who is hungry for real-world experience on a team that researches the future of communications. Interested in VR, Machine Learning, and the future of programming and automation? Those are just a few areas we're working on.

Full Job Description
Overview:
Southwest will provide a stable work environment with equal opportunity for learning and personal growth. Employees will be provided the same concern, respect, and caring attitude within the organization that they are expected to share externally with every Southwest Customer.

Responsibilities:
This Summer Internship is:
May-August, 12 weeks
In Dallas, Texas at our Headquarters Building
Full-time, 40hrs a week M-F during normal business hours
Workplace flexibility depends on the Team – we expect the Intern’s schedule of onsite/remote work to mirror that of their Team. The majority of roles will allow for occasional remote work.
Interns will receive any needed equipment, such as a laptop, for the internship as well as a living stipend and internet stipend paid out one time on your first paycheck (less applicable taxes).

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
The Facilities Department is responsible for the planning, designing, and constructing facilities utilized by Southwest Airlines. Typical projects include development of airport facilities (including new cities), Reservations Centers, Maintenance Hangars, Crew Bases, and Provisioning Bases, as well as renovating and expanding existing facilities system-wide.

The Data Analyst Team is responsible for evaluating the impact of current and future schedules of the 90+ airport facilities. Additionally, they support the Planning Team and any internal/external Customer requests.

The Facilities Analyst Intern will assist this Department with a variety of responsibilities including, but not limited to:

Assisting in data preparation
Traveling to collect data, verify field information, and perform time motion studies
Analyzing forecasted baggage model performance
Performing quality assurance on dashboards and reports

Qualifications:
Basic Qualifications:
High School Diploma, GED or equivalent education required.

Must be at least 18 years of age.

To be eligible, one must be currently enrolled as a full-time student at time of application (minimum of 12 credit hours).

Sophomores or Juniors preferred. Please include your graduation date on your resume.

Minimum of a 3.0 or above cumulative GPA.

Must have authorization to work in the United States as defined by the Immigration Reform Act of 1986.

Education:
Progress towards a bachelors degree in Business Intelligence, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or Industrial Engineering preferred.

Skills:
Strong database management skills preferred (Access, SQL, or similar)
Strong Excel skills preferred (VBA, Pivot Tables, Vlookup, Regressions, etc.)
Basic understanding of root cause, risk analysis, and/or trend analysis preferred
Experience using Tableau is preferred
An Analyst related internship within the past 12 months preferred
Ability to coordinate multiple tasks and complete assignments with tight deadlines
Problem solving ability with strong written/verbal communication skills
Self-starter, critical thinker, and innovator of ideas that could lower cost and increase value for Southwest Airlines
Ability to work independently and willingness to function as part of a Team

TIME COMMITMENT:
Full-time, 40 hours/week. M-F during normal business hours.

PAY:
$18.00 per hour + flight privileges

This position is located in Dallas, Texas at the Southwest Airlines Headquarters building. Interns will be able to work a hybrid schedule that mirrors their Team.

Please print/save the job description because it won’t be available after you apply.

All students must apply online at careers.southwestair.com

Southwest Airlines is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

description:

This is a paid internship starting in Summer 2022.

Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in Duck Creek Suite Distribution Management and integrations with other applications
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.

Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.

Experience in development with the Java programming language and an Integrated Development Environment (i.e. Eclipse).

position: Exciting PR Internship at Sports AI Start-Up Spring '22
description:
Full Job Description

Sparrow is an early-stage startup that uses artificial intelligence (AI) to help athletes improve.

We are offering a valuable Business Marketing Spring internship for a bright, motivated, resourceful college student or recent college graduate looking to learn the ins and outs of the startup, A.I., and sports worlds.

You’ll work closely with the company’s serial-entrepreneur CEO & core business marketing team to strategize and execute the 2022 Agenda and related Public Relations, including:

  • Sparrow's App Store Launch
  • Email Marketing Campaigns
  • User feedback Communication
  • Social Media Presence
  • Public Relations
  • Influencer Outreach
  • And much more!

Person sought must:

  • Be a student at or a recent graduate of a reputable 4-year college, with either a business, communications or marketing related degree and/or experience
  • Be able to work an 8 hour work day (-40 hours per week) middle of January through end of May 2022 or longer (We also offer Part Time internships at 20 hours per week)
  • Be uber-productive, able to switch between different kinds of tasks, and comfortable taking on all jobs complex or mundane.
  • Be experienced and comfortable using online tools like G Suite, email marketing platforms and social media outlets like Youtube, Instagram, and Twitter.
  • Be very detail-oriented and thoughtful when executing a task or initiative
  • Be able to figure out how things work, or how to get things done when a solution isn’t obvious or involves multiple steps or tools

This position represents a unique opportunity to:

  • Work closely with the company founders, successful serial entrepreneurs who have started numerous companies, raised over $20 million in venture capital for them, and have 2 successful exits. (check out our founders here: https://youtu.be/r82gufgzltg)
  • Gain Experience in the PR and Business Marketing Fields
  • Learn the ins-and-outs of running a startup with tremendous potential that is just getting started
  • Receive a $50 weekly stipend, college credit and potentially earn an equity bonus (stock options), and more importantly gain relationships in the tech, AI, and sports industry

Testimonials from Sparrow’s Intern Classes

* My time at Sparrow has been great! I’ve learned the ins and outs of what it takes to successfully run a business + gained valuable insight from the founders. -Gabriel R., Yale University (Men’s Varsity Golf, Econ)

* I was given real responsibilities while working alongside people who really exemplified what it means to be a part of a team. - Georgia L., Williams College (Women’s Varsity Soccer, Psych Major)

*I definitely feel as though I’m honing important skills and experience for when I enter the job market.” said the rising senior. - Abby E., Pomona College in CA (Women’s Varsity Golf, Psych Major)

*At Sparrow I assisted with fundraising rounds, analyzing consumer/user data & conceptualizing macro marketing schemes - experiences that will help me for years to come. - Nick S., USC (Business Major)

* I loved getting exposure into the fast paced start-up world - my internship with Sparrow was awesome!

- Rebecca R., Brown University (Women’s Varsity Soccer, Applied Math major)

* Interning at Sparrow was so valuable! I got to work with the founders and see first hand how a successful company is made! - Annie M, Lehigh (Womens’ Varsity Lacrosse, Business Major)

* My internship with Sparrow was great! I worked on an investment and PR project that contributed to the launch of the company. - Colette M., Columbia University (Women's Varsity Soccer)

** My internship with Sparrow was a valuable one. I worked closely with the co-founders & gained valuable insight into the inner workings of a great startup. - Adam X., Harvard University (Men’s Varsity Golf)

* I worked with an expert machine learning advisor, got my name on a patent and had an all around amazing experience with Sparrow! Trevor J., University of Michigan (Computer Science Major)

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: From $50.00 per week

Benefits:

  • Referral program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • Public Relations: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Work Location: Remote

Full Job Description
Location: Multiple locations across the United States

As the tech firm that created the mobile world, and with more than 54,000 patents to our name, we've made it our business to make a mark. When joining our team at Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead and perform at your best, shaping the future of technology. This is a place where you're welcomed as your own perfectly unique self, and celebrated for the skills, talent, and perspective you bring to the team. Come, and be where it begins.

In our exciting opportunities as an intern, you will enjoy:
1:1 Mentorship
Intern Specific Events & Projects
Career Development
Peer & Senior Level Networking
Participation in Employee Resource Groups

In our internship roles you will need:
3.0+ GPA
Currently pursuing an undergraduate, Master's, or PhD on a full-time basis at a 4-year college or university
Be available to work 40 hours per week during the summer
Have at least 1 semester left (post-internship)
Major, experience, or demonstrable interest in the position you apply for
We have several positions that fall under our Operations & Service Delivery Internship, we are looking for competencies that include:
Operations, Information Technology, Business, Computer Science majors
Knowledge of Lean methodologies, Data & Analytics, or Machine Learning preferred
Experience with various technologies
Sales and support experience
Excellent communication as well as intercultural skills
Open-minded and motivated to work in multicultural team
Strong analytical and organizational skills
Strong customer service orientation
The ideal Ericsson Operations & Service Delivery interns should be:
Enthusiastic solution finders astute in the latest technologies, but with the non-technical savvy to be a valued and respected part of their team. We are looking for undergrad and Master's students.

Hiring Process
Our dedicated team of University Recruiters accept applications from September through April. Most of our positions are filled during the Fall semester though, so we strongly encourage students to apply early.
Apply online (Sept-April)
If selected: A recruiter contacts you via email or phone
If selected: Hiring manager interview
If selected: Offer extended
Start Internship (May or June)
What's in it for you?
Here at Ericsson, our culture is built on over a century of courageous decisions. With us, you will no longer be dreaming of what the future holds - you will be redefining it. You won't develop for the status quo but will build what replaces it. Joining us is a way to move your career in any direction you want; with hundreds of career opportunities in locations all over the world, in a place where co-creation and collaboration are embedded into the walls. You will find yourself in a speak-up environment where empathy and humanness serve as cornerstones for how we work, and where work-life balance is a priority. Welcome to an inclusive, global company where your opportunity to make an impact is endless.

Are you in?

Nearest Major Market: Plano
Nearest Secondary Market: Dallas
Job Segment: Operations Manager, Intern, Computer Science, Operations, Entry Level, Technology

Full Job Description
Company Description

ServiceNow is making the world of work, work better for people. We’re looking for people who are ready to jump right in and help us build on our incredible momentum, our diverse, engaged workforce, and our purpose to make the world of work, work better.

Full Job Description
Powered by endlessly curious people with an unwavering mission focus, Ball Aerospace pioneers discoveries that enable our customers to perform beyond expectation and protect what matters most.

We create innovative space solutions, enable more accurate weather forecasts, drive insightful observations of our planet, deliver actionable data and intelligence, and ensure those who defend our freedom go forward bravely and return home safely.

The Operations Strategic Support Unit plays a fundamental role in enabling efficient business and program execution – from technologies and investments to supply chain, manufacturing and test operations, facilities management, and information technology services.

The Ball Aerospace Internship Program is a 10-week summer program that provides interns with practical experience working on relevant projects while working with designated mentors; access to state-of-the-art equipment; a competitive wage; relocation reimbursement; in-house training; group activities; possible future employment and the ability to participate in the Ball Aerospace Remote Sensing Team (BIRST) program to build and launch a rocket or high-altitude balloon. At the conclusion of your internship, you will be required to prepare and deliver a formal presentation of your project work to your respective department.

Technical Intern- Software Quality Assurance

Ball Aerospace and Technologies Corp. is currently looking for a Software Quality Assurance Analyst to perform manual testing of the Ball Aerospace IT Business applications and systems to include Product Data Management, Procurement, Financial, Anomaly Tracking, Manufacturing, Business Resource Tools, and others. The analyst may work on multiple projects, and operations and maintenance, simultaneously. The successful candidate will work closely with subject matter experts, developers, and product managers to ensure thorough, repeatable, and scalable test cases.

What You’ll Do:
Conduct all aspects of testing and analysis in a highly integrated, complex, regulated environment with multiple Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems.
Create test conditions using manual processes to address change in software, hardware, and database systems in test environment.
Provide potential technical solutions to defects and design flaws.
Create repeatable test procedures to shorten test cycles and provide broader and deeper coverage using in-house tools.
Perform regression testing on enterprise and ancillary applications, application integration bus, and varying systems for all changes.
Review and evaluate test requirements to ensure completeness of test program.
Execute on test conditions using manual and automated processes to address change in software, hardware, and database systems in test environment.
Synthesize customer contractual needs and requirements into system test solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints.
Review technical documentation to ensure technical accuracy, compliance, and completeness to mitigate risk of all types.
Utilize bug tracking system to report defects or design flaws to project teams, application owners, subject matter experts, and developers.
Create software requirements traceability matrix using internal tools to ensure all requirements have test cases and have been validated during testing.
Perform duties within differing SDLC methodologies.
Follow documented or established procedures to perform quality assurance activities.
Maintain a regular and predictable work schedule.
Establish and maintain effective working relationships within the department, the Strategic Business Units, Strategic Support Units and the Company. Interact appropriately with others in order to maintain a positive and productive work environment.
Perform other duties as necessary.

What You’ll Need:
Must have completed your sophomore or junior year and be enrolled in a degree program for the fall of 2022. We will also accept students enrolled in a post graduate program.
Degree must be from a university, college, or school which is accredited by an agency recognized by the US Secretary of Education, US Department of Education.
Ability to work in multiple SDLC’s.

Working Conditions:
Work is performed in an office and home environment.
Travel and local commute between Ball campuses and other possible non-Ball locations may be required.

Relocation for this position is available.

Compensation & Benefits:
HIRING SALARY RANGE: $19.30 - $27.50 per hour (Salary to be determined by the education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data.)
Temporary positions typically are not eligible for benefits. For details, copy and paste https://bit.ly/3pNSnxv into your browser or visit our careers site.

US CITIZENSHIP IS REQUIRED

Ball Aerospace is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Full Job Description
Quanterix is a company on a mission to change the way in which healthcare is provided by giving researchers the ability to closely examine the continuum from health to disease. In our focused therapeutic areas, our revolutionary technology, Simoa®, is helping researchers advance the science of precision health. Simoa® is changing the way in which the biology of health and disease is studied by giving researchers the ability to closely examine critical biomarkers in most therapeutic areas including neurology, infectious disease, oncology, inflammation, and cardiology. To continue our extraordinary growth, we are hiring a Computational Scientist Intern located in Billerica.

We are looking for a creative and driven candidate to join our Technology group that develops algorithms and software in support of our high-sensitivity biomarker detection technologies. This individual will work closely with instrument engineers, software developers, computational scientists, and assay development scientists to optimize the data analysis algorithms that are at the heart of the technology platforms at Quanterix. Specific skills will include a strong background in mathematics, physics, and/or core engineering coursework. Candidate must have an interest in image processing and/or machine learning.

What You'll Do:
Analyze images and develop algorithms to improve performance and sensitivity of biomarker detection
Work within computational science team to implement image processing algorithms in commercial code solutions
Interface with engineers and assay scientists to optimize platforms and develop next generation systems
Implement and test computer vision and machine learning solutions

What We'll Expect From You:
Enrolled in or a recent graduate of a BS degree program in physics, mathematics, computer science, or equivalent (those enrolled in an MS or PhD program will also be considered)
Experience with one or more modern software languages (C, C++, C#, Java, python, Matlab, etc.)
Demonstrated experience or interest in image processing, including concepts such as image smoothing, segmentation, ROI analysis, particle counting, and statistics
Experience or interest in CCD/CMOS cameras and optical systems
Demonstrated self-learner and creative critical thinker
Excellent collaboration and communication capabilities
Ability to work well within cross-functional teams as a team player

Why You'll Like Working For Us:
Our Technology: Quanterix' technology is designed to enable much earlier disease detection, better prognoses and enhanced treatment methods to improve the quality of life and longevity of the population for generations to come. The technology is currently being used for research applications in several therapeutic areas. The company was established in 2007 and is in Billerica, Massachusetts. For additional Information, please visit https://www.quanterix.com.

Our Commitment To Employees: We have a free, state-of-the-art onsite fitness center for all employees. To keep you fueled up, we provide onsite employees free bagels every Monday morning, and free snacks and drinks every day! Quanterix hosts Virtual Bingo nights with all employees when we can see families, pets, and win amazing prizes. Unwind on Tuesdays and Thursdays with a virtual yoga session. In addition to competitive compensation and a 401k plan with an employer match, we offer competitive health, dental, and vision benefits for employees and their dependents. We offer a Flexible Spending Account (FSA), Life, Disability, and Accidental Death & Dismemberment Insurances, and Mental Health Care, we offer generous Maternity & Paternity leave, Family Medical Leave, Fertility Assistance, Dependent Care, Military Leave and Vacation Carryover. All employees are awarded Equity, an Employee Stock Purchase Plan, a Performance Bonus, and 1:1 Financial Counseling/Planning. We also offer Tuition Assistance.

Our Culture: Quanterix is committed to a Diverse and Inclusive workplace. We have a Diversity Program with Executive Sponsorship. Our core values are Accountability, Teamwork, Trust, and Transparency OR ATT2. Meet some of our team HERE. Quanterix is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Quanterix will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.

#LI-FM1

Full Job Description
Achronix Semiconductor Corporation is a fabless semiconductor corporation based in Santa Clara, California, offering high-performance FPGA solutions. Achronix is the only supplier to have both high-performance and high-density standalone FPGAs and embedded FPGA (eFPGA) solutions in high-volume production. Achronix's FPGA and eFPGA IP offerings are further enhanced by ready-to-use PCIe accelerator cards targeting AI, ML, networking and data center applications. All of Achronix's products are supported by best-in-class EDA software tools.

Position Profile Name:Software Engineering Intern

Requisition No.:Intern

Type of Position:Regular, Exempt

Reports to:Sr. Principal Engineer

Location:Santa Clara, California

Contact:hr@achronix.com

Job Description/Responsibilities

Depending on your background and experience you will be working with a mentor in our Software Engineering team in one of the following areas:

EDA Software Developer

Add features to, find and fix bugs in, or create new core algorithms for, our flagship EDA (Electronic Design Automation) tool ACE (Achronix CAD Environment). This could include work on one of the following: algorithms for logic synthesis and mapping; netlist optimization for timing, area, and power; FPGA global or detailed placement; FPGA routing; static timing analysis; static or dynamic power analysis. Requires experience with C++ and the C++ STL (Standard Template Library), and with the runtime/memory tradeoffs and implementation of common algorithms and data structures.

EDA Software QA (Testing, Verification, and Documentation)

Write unit tests and regression tests to find bugs and verify bug fixes and new features in our flagship EDA (Electronic Design Automation) tool ACE (Achronix CAD Environment). Learn from domain experts how to use new features in ACE, and write first-draft documentation in the form of User Guide entries and/or Tutorial documents.

GUI Developer

Add features to, find and fix bugs in the GUI (Graphical User Interface) for our flagship EDA (Electronic Design Automation) tool ACE (Achronix CAD Environment). Requires experience with Java and the Eclipse framework, as well as basic APIs for message passing and thread management. A background in tool usability and HCI (Human Computer Interaction) is a plus.

AI/ML Engineer

Aid in the development of the software stack for an FPGA-based ML (Machine Learning) inference accelerator card reference platform. Familiarity is desired with compilers such as Glow, TVM, CLANG or LLVM; machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Caffe2, MXNet, and Keras; and with models such as AlexNet, ResNet50, Inception, YOLO, RNN, and LSTM.

DevOps Engineer

Support the agile development process of our flagship EDA (Electronic Design Automation) tool ACE (Achronix CAD Environment). Using a combination of 3rd party tools and internally-developed scripts, develop and support processes for bug tracking, continuous integration, regression testing, and QoR (Quality of Results) monitoring and analysis. Requires skill in one or more of: Bugzilla, TextTest, MySQL, Dokuwiki, Confluence, Perforce, Git, CMake, GCC, Django, Python, Perl, Tcl, or automated GUI testing.

Required Skills
Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s, Master’s or PhD degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Applied Math, or a related field
Skilled practitioner in C++ or Java. Experience in a scripting language (Python, Perl, or Tcl) and a hardware description language (Verilog or VHDL)
Eligible to work in the United States

position: Engineering Development Program Internship - Smart Infrastructure Electrical Products
description:
Full Job Description
Are you interested in gaining exposure to developing the systems and smart solutions that keep cities growing, businesses flourishing and people safe? Here at Siemens, we make real what matters through our inclusive and rewarding work environment. Come be a part of the Engineering Development Internship Program, where you can intern helping to build and implement new products, technologies, and applications!

The Siemens US Summer Intern Program is built to produce a pipeline of talent to develop and lead into our entry-level programs. As an Engineering Development Program (EDP) Intern, you’ll get hands on experience in a company with over 50,000 employees in the US. At the end of your internship, your performance will be evaluated to be considered for the EDP Program and other Entry-Level Opportunities within our organization.

Engineering Development Program

This is a 12-week summer internship program that offers hands-on experience in a real-world working environment. Allowing the chance to apply the knowledge you've gained in the classroom setting to help problem solve!

Providing you with the exposure, network, and practical experience you will need to help discover your own personal version of success and identify your career path upon graduating.

Specific intern work assignments will involve a wide range of functions, including product design, feasibility analysis, quality assurance, manufacturing, project management, service, product management, applications engineering.

Career Track: Upon successful completion of the internship program, you may have the opportunity to interview for the fulltime program to become a Development Engineer, Product Engineer, R&D Engineer, Software / Hardware Engineer and testing engineer just to name a few.

The program starts in May.

Requirements

Major: Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Software Engineering, or Computer Science
Preferred GPA: 3.0
Ability to work 40 hours per week from May to August
Organized, self-motivated, effective communication skills, problem-solver
High attention to detail and dedicated to quality and excellence
Proficient in use of Microsoft Office Suite
Work Authorization: Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States without need for current or future employer-sponsored work authorization.

Our Culture:
At Siemens, we live and foster an ownership culture, in which every employee takes personal responsibility for our company's success. We trust and empower our leaders to act as owners, direct their teams, and innovate to succeed. We communicate openly and honestly to learn from our failures and celebrate our successes. We recognize individual and team achievements frequently. We invest in our team members, offering a wide variety of internal and external development opportunities.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Full Job Description
Company: FedEx Services
Job Title: Intern Information Technology - Pittsburgh
Job Requisition Number: RC418582
Category: Intern
Pay Type: Non-exempt

Locations:
Coraopolis, Pennsylvania 15108
United States

Are ready for your career to take flight with FedEx? Join us for our 10-week internship program where you work on real-world projects, collaborate with team members, and have fun along the way. At FedEx, our internship program is for college students who are pursing either an undergraduate or graduate degree. As a FedEx intern, you will be working on projects directly related to your degree getting you valuable, real-world experience. Our culture at FedEx, is putting people first. We promote growth and opportunity for all of our employees. FedEx interns will also have the opportunity to participate in several organized events including community service, executive speaking engagements, and networking opportunities. Deliver what’s next in your career with FedEx by applying today!

Minimum Qualifications:
High school graduate or equivalent. Student has completed at least two years toward a college degree. Completion of a college degree OR enrollment as undergraduate or graduate student in business, business analytics, management, finance, economics, information security/science/technology, information systems, computer science, engineering, statistics, or other related major.

Position Information
Operating an extensive global computer network, the FedEx Services IT department contains approximately 5,000 professionals. IT positions range from highly technical to more business-focused, including but not limited to the following:

Application Development
Business Analyst
Computer Engineering
Computer Science
Customer Technology Consultant
Database Administration
Data Science
Development
Information Security
IT Architecture
Project Management/SAFe Agile
Software Engineering
Supply Chain
System Administration
Systems Support
Technical Analysis

Full-time internship opportunity from June 2022 to August 2022 This position can be domiciled in the Pittsburgh, PA area. This job posting is multiple areas within IT.

Technical Roles

Under close supervision, the successful candidate will apply modern technology to assist with development of computer programs and applications for real-world FedEx business initiatives. Projects may involve mobile applications, web development, Quality Assurance testing automation, big data platforms, revenue systems, and/or architecture development. Technologies used may include Tibco, Hibernate, ICEFACES, Ab Initio, Hadoop, Platfora, Spotfire, Java/J2EE & related frameworks, JMS, JavaScript, HTML5, .Net, C, C++, C#, Oracle, Weblogic, JBOSS, JDBC, subversion, and/or Query Languages such as PL/SQL. The candidate may complete root cause analysis as well as test, document, and implement IT projects for FedEx IT initiatives. Individuals may also perform database design, database support, and systems enhancements. Individuals will work either on a team of 3-6 interns or on individual project assignments.

What are we looking for in a summer intern?

Solid foundation in computing
Knowledge and/or experience with one or more of the following: Java/J2EE & related frameworks, JMS, JavaScript, HTML5, .Net, C, C++, C#, Oracle, SharePoint, Weblogic, JBOSS, JDBC, subversion, and/or Query Languages such as PL/SQL.
Knowledge and/or experience with one of the following: system administration, systems applications, systems architecture, database administration, and technical requirements analysis.
Familiarity with Unix, Linux or Windows administration and scripting.
Familiarity with designing and evaluating IT solutions.
Hardware and software technical background.
Experience in IT or Information Security.
Strong analytical and communication skills, including technical writing.
Basic understanding of business principles and project management.
Strong attention to detail and ability to complete large volumes of work efficiently and effectively.

The following are considered a plus:
Enrollment as undergraduate at junior year or above or graduate student in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Information Science, Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Computer Information Systems, Network Engineering, Programming, Information Security, Mechanical Engineering, Information Technology, Information Engineering, Business Analysis, Data Structures and Analysis, or other quantitative major.
Ideally, plans to graduate within 12 months of completing the internship and begin full-time employment.

Business Analyst and Project Management/SAFe Agile-Focused Roles
Under close supervision, the successful candidate may assist with technology industry research, global business intelligence, and emerging trends analysis. Work may also include analysis of specific business metrics and research/analysis of data, industry trends, and market information. The project may relate to a mobile app, geo-fencing, revenue systems, or another initiative. Individuals will work on an agile team.

The successful candidate may assist with one or more of the following:

Conduct data analytics, report development, and/or research for FedEx IT initiatives.
Interact with business partners and/or IT staff to gather, plan, design, implement, and document software requirements for a FedEx IT project matched to business needs, systems functions, and business process flows.
Address customer problems or requests for information on customer automation systems, FedEx software and/or FedEx deployed technologies.
Analyze business needs, implement customer solutions and provide technical product support.
Measuring and analyzing trends and validating need for process changes to maintain optimum customer support and satisfaction.

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and experience:

Business and project/program management skills, Agile Methodologies; organizational skills; ability to manage multiple tasks, set priorities and monitor ongoing results; leadership skills.
Basic knowledge of one or more of the following: the software development process, systems applications and architecture, networking, Query Languages, “R,” MATLAB, Python, C++, objective-C, C#, Swift, Java, iOS/Android Mobile development, and SQL.
Analytical and research skills; knowledge and/or experience with statistics or big data and report design/development.
Knowledge or experience with one or more of the following: data analytics, forecasting/modeling, strategy planning, and project management.
Experience in analytical/quantitative business, operations, or economics; coursework or experience in global studies.
Ability to synthesize large volumes of data (quantitative and qualitative).
Ability to solve business and technical customer-related issues.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; presentation skills; knowledge of PowerPoint or Prezi and the Office suite.

The following are considered a plus:
Enrollment as undergraduate at junior year or above or graduate student in Business, Management, Project Management, Supply Chain, Transportation, Operations, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Business Analysis, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Information Systems, Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Information Technology, Engineering, or other related major.
Ideally, plans to graduate within 12 months of completing the internship and begin full-time employment.

Make sure your resume has the following information:
College address and permanent home address.
Email address.
Telephone number.
The following regarding the degree you are currently pursuing and any previous undergraduate or graduate degrees:
Name of college/university.
Degree (For example, bachelor’s degree, master’s degree, or doctorate).
Major and/or minor.
Overall GPA.
Major GPA.
Date of intended graduation (Month and year).

Expected Internship Program Timeline

Interviews typically occur October-January.
Offers are typically extended October-February.
Internship occurs early June-mid-August.

Domicile Location:
This position can be domiciled in the Pittsburgh, PA area.
The ability to work remotely within the United States may be available based on business need.
Relocation assistance not available.

The company does not offer immigration sponsorship for the permanent position(s) that will be offered to successful interns who are hired into the Foundations Program or full-time entry level positions (below the SK salary band).
